parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
